s1.title: Dependancies
s1.p: Jesktop needs Avalon. Avalon needs JDK1.3 (to be built) or JRE 1.3 (to run on). To build Jesktop, you'll need to have set two environmental varables:

Jesktop, like Avalon, uses Apache's Ant system for building the classes and jars from source. They both include their own version of Ant in their distribution. You don't need to download and install Ant separately. In fact, if you have Ant installed, you may get some problems building Jesktop as the two versions might be incompatible.
For those that haven't heard the news, Ant is the defacto standard for building Java based projects. Read about it at Apache's Ant website

s1.title: Installation using the Full-Source distribution of Jesktop (which includes Avalon)
s1.p: There are multiple downloads for you to do, that range in size from 15Kb (JCalculator app) to 4.4Mb (Jesktop's source with Avalon). See Downloads page.

ol.li: Download and unzip Jesktop and the separate applications zips.
Go into jesktop/ or the root directory of whichever application you have downloaded and run "build".
Also from the command line run "build docs" for Jesktop to make these documents and the API docs.
Using Simple installer locate jars in their "dist" directories and install them. See Built-in apps for more.
Launch things from the Start button and play with them.

s1.title: Step by Step Installation from Perforce source depot

ol.li: As part of your perforce setup, choose a place on your hard drive for the depot. There may, in time, be more than just Jesktop in there, so we have a dir like c:\oss_perforce_co_uk\
Do a "sync to head revision" on the Jesktop node. This may be slow for the first run, but will be very fast for second and subsequent.
Follow instructions above from "build" and downwards.

Every time you want to see the new version, just do another sync and run the build batch file. Sometimes "build clean" is a good idea if we have been deleting files/classes. Perforce handles that very well but Ant does not.
